title: A fast-food clerk asking where the food will be eaten
context: Ask the customer if their meal is for here or to go.

content.bestLine: Is your meal for here or to go?

neutral.text: Will you be eating in or taking out?
Is this to stay or to go?
Will you be dining in or taking it with you?
Do you want to eat in or take out?
Is your order to eat here or take away?
Will you be eating here or taking it to go?

informal.text: You gonna eat here or take it with you?
Is this for here or to go, buddy?
You eating in or taking out, man?
For here or to go, dude?
You wanna eat in or grab it to go?
Is your food to stay or to go, friend?

formal.text: Will you be dining with us or taking your order to go?
Is your order for consumption on our premises or to be taken away?
Would you like to eat in our dining area or take your food with you?
Please let me know if your order is to be eaten here or taken to go.

patterns.meaning: Asking where the food will be eaten
Asking where the food will be eaten

lines.speaker: Clerk
lines.text: Is your meal for here or to go?

lines.speaker: Customer
lines.text: I'll take it to go, please.

lines.speaker: Clerk
lines.text: You gonna eat here or take it with you?
